Prince Dastan.Action: Sits calmly and confident among rough soldiers, exposing his wrist guard as a form of bet and assertion, showing composure and confidence.
Rolls a three on the dice, a bad roll in gambling, showing an apparent failure in that moment.
Calmly diffuses a conflict by proposing a fair wager instead of resorting to violence.
Displays confidence and skill yet remains composed among common soldiers, earning their encouragement.
Draws a dagger quickly to threaten a soldier, causing tension and fear.
Dismisses rumors about Alamut and insists on attacking if they sided with the enemy, showing a rigid and harsh stance.
Draws his sword quickly motivated by thirst for glory, leading others into battle.
Spots the saboteurs threatening his troops and immediately acts to stop them, risking personal safety.
Fights determinedly against multiple enemies to protect fellow soldiers.
Ends up flung into danger due to burning catapult but keeps fighting.
Fights his way free after being attacked and inspects the fallen warrior carefully, including removing his armor to aid him and listening for last words.
Notices and retrieves the unusual ceremonial dagger from the dead warrior, showing curiosity and awareness of potentially important objects.
Slumps to a seated position, appearing spent and possibly overwhelmed after the fight and death of the warrior.
Allows himself to be perceived as a looter by Tamina due to taking the dagger from the dead man.
Rejects praise from his brothers, showing humility and focus on deeper values rather than flattery.
Sits reading a book calmly during a caravan journey, indicating a reflective and possibly considerate nature.
Opened the gate to aid in battle, turning the tide of it.
Refuses to seek or accept praise from his brothers despite his success.
Expresses confusion along with the Twins when the gifts from Alamut are mentioned, showing empathy and shared uncertainty.
Does not interrupt or correct the Twins when they awkwardly present the gifts, showing tolerance and patience.
Throws himself into his father's embrace, hugs him hard.
Brings a meaningful gift (Robe of Honor) to his father with pride and joy.
Does not try to kill Tamina during their fight, only seeks to disarm her.
Speaks with a hint of condescension calling Tamina 'Slave-Girl.'
Reacts with confusion and fear when Tamina asks a question and points away from her, backing away as if she’s a witch.
Makes a friendly 'excuse us' gesture to the shepherd boy despite the boy aiming an arrow at him.
Turns back to return the silver bracelet to the shepherd boy, showing consideration.
Reassures Tamina calmly when approaching hostile soldiers, showing care and confidence.
Makes a friendly gesture to the armed shepherd boy and then cleverly decides to retrieve his silver bracelet as a sign of trust or connection.
Disguises himself by shedding princely armor and traveling with Tamina disguised as a shepherd boy to avoid detection at the checkpoint.
Assures Tamina that he no longer looks like a prince and tries to keep morale high despite tense circumstances.
Notices Tamina’s dehydration and gives her his water instead of drinking it himself.
Releases Tamina from her bindings discreetly to avoid making a big deal out of it.
Justifies stealing food from nomads by calling them bandits and saying 'It all evens out.'
Gives Tamina a reassuring look when she is worried about him gambling away their only weapon.
Gives the Gypsy Boy a reproachful look after the boy distracts him during his dagger throw.
Answers Farood honestly about his dire situation and intentions without boasting or evasion.
Shakes head with empathy listening to Farood's sorrow about his daughters and the lack of a worthy suitor.
Considers Farood’s offer of hospitality and agrees to travel with the caravan despite Tamina's objections.
Responds calmly and kindly to Tamina's prejudice against the caravan, advising her to be quiet.
Winks at Tamina to encourage her and acknowledges her finding a friend.
Smiles queasily at Farood’s offer but does not engage enthusiastically with the crude proposal.
Quickly offers one hundred dinars for the dagger, showing decisiveness and respect for the seller's worth.
Disagrees firmly but respectfully with Farood over bargaining strategy, showing independence and sincerity in desire.
Returns to negotiate directly with Lenk instead of accepting Farood's plan, showing initiative but somewhat stubbornness.
Attempts to pay the agreed price promptly, showing trustworthiness and straightforwardness.
Commands Tamina to stop the provocative dancing; shows concern and protective instinct.
Resists pursuing Tamina immediately to avoid confrontation and protect himself and others.
Jumps to action quickly after realizing the theft; attempts to chase Tamina despite danger.
Stops from impulsively chasing Tamina immediately to avoid exposure to Garsiv, showing restraint and strategic thinking.
Quickly climbs onto rooftops and maneuvers nimbly to get a vantage point and pursue Tamina, demonstrating agility and situational awareness.
Rushes toward the stage but is blocked by a crowd, showing some lack of anticipation or control over the environment.
Appeals to Farood for help by invoking romantic spirit, friendship, and goodwill.
Wipes a fake tear from his eye to persuade Farood.
Attempts to cut Tamina's hands free by throwing a knife, despite the risk.
Laughs nervously after almost harming Tamina, showing sincerity and humility.
Uses a tripline to incapacitate onrushing soldiers protecting Tamina, acting protectively.
Wraps arms around Tamina and searches her body to pull out the dagger, displaying physical intimacy and trust.
Defends his brother Tus, despite accusations; shows willingness to seek truth and avoid rash judgment.
Acknowledges Tamina's new information and expresses shock; agrees to cooperate with her to reach his brother and discuss the situation.
Walks away warily after the heated conversation, indicating reservation and some emotional distance.
Defends his brother Tus by presenting a reasoned argument about the attack being due to enemy supply and a spy confession, showing awareness of political complexity.
Acknowledges uncertainty about the spy confession by admitting he did not hear it directly but through a translator (Nizam), demonstrating intellectual honesty and caution.
Shows shock and surprise upon learning that Nizam was responsible for poisoning the robe of honor, indicating susceptibility to deception and possible lack of vigilance.
Despite being confronted with surprising new information, maintains a plan to reach his brother and openly share all facts to let Tus decide, showing leadership and strategic thinking.
Exchanges a nervous glance with Tamina, showing concern about entering the city.
Starts to reveal something significant to Farood, indicating honesty and trustworthiness.
Gives his word to Tamina about his brother's honor and promises that Nizam will answer for his treason
Trusts Tamina by slowly placing the dagger in her hand despite hesitation and suspicion
Complains cynically about women to a fellow prisoner, implying distrust and generalization.
Expresses shock and distrust when Tamina reveals herself as the jailor, initially assuming betrayal.
Acknowledges the beliefs of another character with a sigh and respects her faith despite his own doubts.
Apologizes to the lion (figuratively) after stepping on the black stone, showing respect and sincerity.
Immediately dives into the chasm to save Tamina without hesitation.
Reassures Tamina by telling her to take a deep breath before helping her escape underwater.
Snatches the dagger mid-fall to stop time and then rewinds events to avoid death.
Carefully observes the collapsing dam and immediately acts to save Tamina by diving into the chasm and swimming through dangerous currents.
Tackles Tamina to the ground to protect her from a spear.
Yanks Tamina to her feet and helps her escape soldiers pursuing them.
Respects Tamina's wish not to use the dagger even though he is frustrated.
Performs a risky maneuver to put soldiers behind them and clear a path for Tamina.
Encourages Tamina to hold tight and jump together off the bridge despite danger, showing trust and protective instinct.
Shows quick thinking and bravery by using the rope to attempt an escape, indirectly trying to save both himself and Tamina.
Dismisses Tamina’s suggestion to use the dagger to escape, implying overconfidence or possible recklessness that might endanger both.
BARRICADES the door to protect Tus, tries to explain the truth to him despite Tus's suspicion and anger.
Throws away his sword to show he is unarmed and not threatening Tus.
Improvises and reveals important truths about Nizam and their father to Tus, attempting to gain trust.
Uses the dagger to hold guards at bay, asks for a moment to think rather than immediately attacking.
Shows frustration and self-reproach (saying 'Damn it!') when his attempt to convince Tus fails.
Swiftly brings the dagger’s blade to his throat, and when guards hesitate, plunges it into his own heart to prove his point or conviction.
Demonstrates confidence and decisiveness in a high-stress situation by using extreme self-sacrifice to try to convince others.
Unaware that the dagger is empty during the rewind, repeating the same dramatic gesture without realizing the change.
Thanks brother Tus after being saved from self-harm.
Invites Tus to meet Tamina, showing trust and willingness to share.
Protests innocence despite being bound and beaten, showing resilience and trustworthiness.
Does not retaliate violently while being beaten by guards, showing restraint and tolerance.
Is passively silenced and does not escalate conflict even when falsely accused.
Allows others to be punished alongside him without visible anger or suspicion, suggesting loyalty.
Rages at Nizam for freeing Tamina and tries desperately to free himself from chains despite agony
Calls out for Tamina weakly while barely conscious in dungeon
Does not retaliate or resist when unchained by guards, appears limp and unresisting
Rejects escape initially, refuses freedom while others remain imprisoned.
Unlocks the prisoners’ cells to free them, incites them to rise despite personal danger.
Acknowledges the prisoners' hatred fairly and honestly, expresses empathy for their suffering.
Spins low and uses an unorthodox move to topple Garsiv off the cliff, saving himself.
Starts to come to Tamina's aid when she fights the guards but hesitates after she insists he must stop Nizam.
Performs an impossible back bend to narrowly evade a lethal sword strike, then quickly counterattacks to topple Garsiv over the cliff edge.
Scrambles to aid Tamina but hesitates when she tells him to ignore her and focus on stopping Nizam.
Clobbers Nizam to stop him from striking the hourglass, trying to prevent a deadly outcome.
Engages in a duel to confront Nizam despite being outmatched and ultimately wounded.
Grins at Nizam after disarming him, showing confidence even in a dire moment.
Lunges to stop Nizam from plunging the dagger into the hourglass despite the urgent danger, showing quick response and bravery.
Hears Tamina's screams as she falls and tries to pull himself up with all his strength, demonstrating perseverance and physical capability.
Appears stunned and disoriented in the center of the sandstorm after time rewinds, indicating a momentary lapse or vulnerability.
Insists on truth, refuses to attack unjustly despite pressure from his brother Tus.
Kills Nizam in combat after being attacked and lied to.
Recognizes Nizam's deception and warns others, showing situational awareness.
Takes a bold and desperate risk by attacking Nizam on horseback, demonstrating courage and combat skill.
Freezes and hesitates momentarily when Tus arrives and commands him to stop, showing some internal conflict but maintaining control.
Displays quick reflexes and combat expertise by blocking both of Nizam's sword strikes and defeating him decisively.
Refuses to obey Tus's command to put down the sword despite the threat, indicating confidence but risking conflict with an ally.
Quickly pulls a dagger and holds it inches from the brutish soldier's face, showing impressive reflexes and confidence.
Proposes a skill challenge (knife throw) instead of a fight, demonstrating strategic thinking and calm under pressure.
Concentrates and skillfully flips the dagger several times before throwing, displaying practiced focus and technique.
Misses the target with the dagger throw, which could indicate a momentary lapse in skill or luck.
Accepts the dagger from the Brutish Soldier without anger, saying 'A bet’s a bet. Keep it.'
Calmly accepts the dagger from the brutish soldier and keeps his word with confidence.
Responds quickly and decisively to the herald's summons, showing readiness and leadership.
Reassures fearful soldiers by calmly acknowledging Alamut fighters as 'flesh and bone, like us.'
Offers to polish Farhad's armor if he fights well.
Exchanges friendly banter with Farhan about polishing armor.
Is mesmerized by the unfamiliar spectacle of gunpowder fireworks during battle.
Responds calmly to soldiers' superstitions, offers practical and confident observations about the enemy.
Takes initiative by riding ahead to join his brothers, showing leadership and situational awareness.
Exhibits lighthearted confidence when speaking to Farhad about fighting and polishing armor, indicating self-assurance and morale boosting.
Is momentarily mesmerized by the exploding flaming arrow, demonstrating vulnerability to unfamiliar tactics.
Instinctively raises shield to block an arrow and spots hidden enemy archers quickly, showing alertness and combat readiness.
Spots the presence of enemy saboteurs and quickly acts to stop them from sabotaging the catapult.
Exhibits skill and determination by engaging two formidable saboteurs simultaneously and ultimately knocking them into flames.
Fails to prevent the catapult from catching fire and does not stop the rope from burning through, leading to him being flung into the air uncontrollably.
Uses quick reflexes and improvised technique by grabbing onto canvas awnings to slow his fall, demonstrating presence of mind under pressure.
Runs out of awnings to catch himself and is left in a precarious situation, indicating a momentary failure to fully secure his safety.
Uses clever parkour and fighting skills to evade multiple enemies and open the gate for his army.
Effectively uses environment with parkour-style fighting, evading multiple attackers skillfully.
Realizes dagger sheath is empty because he gambled it away, indicating a lapse in preparation.
Takes a rapid decision to escape danger by sliding down a cable under attack.
Quickly flips and defeats guards, then intelligently uses the crank lever to raise the gate for reinforcements.
Fights side by side with comrades without hesitation.
Notices Tamina's signal and looks up, acknowledging her presence.
Engages in intense combat and survives by quick thinking and agility.
Throws himself on the enemy warrior to disarm him, possibly saving from lethal strike.
Runs straight up the wall, pushes off with a backflip, and lands on the horse to engage the warrior.
Grapples on horseback with a heavily armored opponent, enduring punishment but continuing to fight.
Throws his arms around the warrior’s waist to drag him from the saddle and crash to the ground, then fights his way loose.
Appears trapped and almost trampled without an immediate escape.
Removes the fallen warrior’s helmet and breastplate to ease his suffering and listens to his final words
Sheathes the ceremonial dagger from the dead warrior’s body, appearing to take a valuable object
Approaches his brothers and admits to opening the gate despite their criticism
Expresses desire to earn his father's favor honestly and independently, valuing personal achievement over inherited status.
Acknowledges his reliance on the army built by his father and his own current lack of distinct achievements.
Strategizes to bring a suitable gift to gain favor, carefully selecting a rich embroidered silk robe despite limited personal resources.
Considers taking loot from the caravan without explicit permission, indicating a moment of moral or strategic ambiguity.
Smiles tauntingly at Garsiv, teasing about beating him in the tournament.
Eats heartily and unapologetically among nobles who eat delicately, responding with humor and confidence to criticism.
Notices Tamina struggling with her tray and offers to help her, addressing her kindly as a 'delicate flower'.
Lifts the heavy tray from Tamina and offers her a goblet of wine to ease her burden.
Grants Tamina a temporary reprieve from her duties, despite social rank differences.
Laughs modestly and claims to be a 'modern thinker' who values people beyond social status.
Misinterprets Tamina's anger and curse towards him as fear of the Matron.
Lifts the heavy tray from Tamina’s hands and carefully places it on a nearby table, demonstrating attentiveness and physical skill.
Offers wine to Tamina in a courteous manner, showing social grace and confidence.
Misinterprets Tamina’s fearful reaction to the goblets as fear of being caught, indicating a lack of cultural or situational awareness.
Claims he is a modern thinker who disregards social rank, attempting to connect with Tamina but doing so somewhat naively.
Tries to impress Tamina by speaking openly and modestly about his status, but fails to realize the impact of the dagger she notices, suggesting a lack of perception.
Shows confusion at the Twins' mistakes about Alamut's conquest, indicating awareness of political and military realities.
Does not correct or clarify the Twins' error immediately, potentially missing an opportunity to demonstrate leadership and quick thinking.
Hurts himself to catch his dying father, showing care and concern.
Emotionally struggles and chokes back tears proclaiming his innocence.
Desperately tries to get Nizam to speak on his behalf.
Breaks free violently, fights guards, and escapes custody.
Acknowledges Tamina's help and thanks her sincerely, then instructs her to hide for safety.
Despite danger, rides straight at a superior force to create a distraction and enable Tamina's escape.
Defends himself and Tamina skillfully, showing quick thinking and care to protect an ally.
Slows down to help Tamina when she is in trouble despite being pursued and threatened.
Fights to reach and protect Tamina, knocking off soldiers one by one.
Encourages Tamina to trust him and jump to his horse despite danger.
Refers to Tamina as 'Slave-Girl' despite showing kindness.
Uses the momentum of his horse to run up a canyon wall and grab a shrub, escaping soldiers.
Launches off the wall and takes out a rider harassing Tamina, fighting his way to her.
Blocks an unexpected sword strike at the last moment, avoiding injury.
Executes a quick maneuver by scrambling across an enemy's saddle to join Tamina, enabling escape.
Calmly instructs Tamina to jump to a less suitable but more reliable mountain horse despite her hesitation.
Leaps with his horse down a steep cliff, skillfully navigating dangerous terrain to evade enemies.
Thinks aloud to piece together the mystery behind his framing, showing strategic insight.
Dismounts and confronts Tamina, maintaining composure after surprise attack.
Dodges Tamina's sword attack by sheer reflex and recovers with effective defense despite injury.
Draws sword and blocks Tamina’s attack, then disarms her but states he doesn't want to hurt her and warns her against attacking again.
Uses the dagger to stop time and rewind events, demonstrating quick thinking and adaptability.
Initially slower to react when Tamina attacks and gets slashed across the chest.
Blocks Tamina's sword attack and disarms her on the third attempt, showing skill and improved awareness.
Forgives Tamina despite her attacking him and groveling, and invites her to leave together.
Lets Tamina clean his boots patiently while observing her, showing tolerance and some friendliness.
Presses the dagger repeatedly while suspecting something, indicating mistrust and suspicion.
Considers Tamina's offer and decides to use her local knowledge despite mistrusting her, showing tactical judgment and openness to assistance.
Skillfully and quickly ties Tamina’s wrists together to prevent potential threat, showing preparedness and physical skill.
Saddles Tamina up despite her protests, asserting control and decisiveness in a tense situation.
Admits to making Tamina clean his boots to lower her guard, showing cunning and strategic social manipulation.
Shows hesitance when confronted with the language barrier and Tamina’s question, indicating some uncertainty.
Notices Tamina's dehydration and selflessly offers her water instead of drinking himself.
Releases Tamina from her bindings quickly and without making a fuss, showing practical confidence.
Chooses to rely on faith ('God will provide') instead of devising a concrete survival plan or rationing resources.
Plans to steal food from nomads identified as bandits, showing pragmatic but morally ambiguous decision-making.
Dismisses Tamina’s concern about morality of stealing by labeling the nomads as bandits, indicating possible oversimplification of complex situations.
Sneaks into a nomad tent and steals food due to hunger.
Shares a moment of recognition and acknowledgment with a calf after stealing food.
Dashes away with stolen food and a chicken, causing a commotion attracting pursuers.
Commands Tamina to run from danger, showing concern for her safety.
Releases the captured chicken when confronted, showing some respect or restraint.
Sneaks through a camp avoiding detection and quickly finds and eats food to satisfy hunger.
Responds swiftly when dogs attack by tying the tent flap shut to block them.
Uses a chicken as a distraction or means to flee from pursuers.
Dashes ahead without waiting for Tamina, potentially putting himself at risk or abandoning caution.
Stops abruptly when confronted by enemies and prepares to fight, showing readiness and situational awareness.
Releases the chicken on command from Farood, demonstrating respect for authority and quick adaptation.
Uses a disguise and humble story to gain trust and diffuse tension.
Quotes a proverb about giving freely to those in need.
Acknowledges the hunger and needs of others with empathy.
Proposes a non-violent resolution (wager of skill) instead of fighting.
Refuses to overvalue his sword and recklessly put others at risk.
Adopts a disguised identity to gain trust and attempts negotiation rather than immediate conflict.
Uses clever rhetoric and calm reasoning to de-escalate a hostile situation and avoid unnecessary violence.
Recognizes unfavorable odds in direct combat and proposes an alternative contest to minimize risk.
Fails to anticipate Tamina's outrage at his deception, potentially damaging relations with allies.
Shows empathy by shaking his head in response to Farood's sorrow.
Considers Farood’s daughters and the situation thoughtfully, indicating reflection.
Accepts the offer to carry Farood’s sword within the caravan, demonstrating diplomatic acceptance.
Responds calmly to Tamina’s outrage about travelling with the gypsies, showing control and confidence.
Does not directly address Tamina's distrust of the caravan, potentially ignoring risk concerns.
Shows playful behavior doing handsprings to entertain nomads; notices Tamina’s limp and inquires if she’s okay.
Waves and smiles sincerely at the gypsy women despite social awkwardness, indicating friendliness and acceptance.
Shrugs off Tamina’s reluctance to admit discomfort, showing some tolerance but also minor detachment.
Maintains composure and social awareness when encountering Farood's eleven daughters and the offer of a business partnership.
Winks at Tamina after she is approached by Haleema, demonstrating confidence and social grace.
Pauses his game with the dagger upon hearing a distant noise and quickly assesses the situation as horsemen approach, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Notices Tamina rubbing her raw and aching feet and turns away to avoid embarrassing her further, showing concern.
Buys a donkey for Tamina to ease her pain, trading his valuable dagger despite the risks.
Hustles Tamina aside quickly when others start staring at her because she is a talking mute, protecting her privacy.
Accuses Tamina of lying and calls her an 'idiot' in frustration over communication issues.
Notices Tamina's discomfort and chooses to turn away to avoid embarrassing her further.
Acquires a donkey for Tamina to ease her foot pain by trading his throwing dagger at the bazaar.
Fails to recognize that Tamina was lying about the dagger's magic being used up.
Immediately removes Tamina from public view when he realizes other caravan members are noticing her talking despite being known as mute.
Bluntly reprimands Tamina for not telling the truth, showing frustration but also encouraging honesty.
Attempts to track down the dagger by following trades and barters through merchants, demonstrating persistence and some logical deduction.
Mistakenly believes the jar contains perfume, showing a lack of careful verification before trusting merchant claims.
Admits the need for an expert to help navigate the traders, showing realistic self-assessment and practical leadership.
Swiftly pulls Tamina clear of soldiers' feet after she is knocked down.
Averts his face while leading Tamina away, avoiding eye contact.
Tells Tamina to forget the dagger, expressing disregard for her magic relic.
Shows suspicion toward Tamina's sudden eagerness to help.
Offers to negotiate respectfully with Lenk the innkeeper, using polite greeting and careful words to obtain the dagger.
Stares blankly and seemingly distracted when Farood speaks about his daughters and the subtlety needed in dealing with merchants.
Instantly agrees to pay price and dance for Lenk's guests, showing willingness to help Tamina despite potential risk.
Speaks guiltily outside curtained doorway indicating empathy and concern for Tamina's feelings.
Slouches down to avoid being seen by Garsiv and soldiers, possibly to protect Tamina by not attracting attention.
Does not warn Tamina directly when Garsiv and soldiers enter, perhaps due to lack of time or fear; a negative non-action regarding warmth due to omission of protection or warning.
Instantly agrees to pay the high price and dance, showing decisiveness and confidence.
Slouches down in his seat to avoid detection by Garsiv and soldiers, attempting to be discreet and cautious.
Unable to warn Tamina about the soldiers entering, indicating a momentary failure to act effectively.
Demonstrates dance moves gently to Tamina to encourage her, tries to support her despite crowd hostility.
Watches Tamina nervously and hides under table to protect himself, showing caution rather than confrontation.
Participates in Tamina’s seductive dance but does not reciprocate physically, respects personal boundaries.
Demonstrates dance moves to Tamina to guide her and encourage performance under pressure.
Hides nervously behind Farood and glances around anxiously, showing some uncertainty.
Ducks under the table suddenly, which confuses his ally Farood, indicating a flawed or unclear action.
Tries to maintain composure and control of the situation by signaling and managing Tamina's performance to win over the crowd.
Paces nervously, weighing pros and cons about rescuing Tamina despite risks to himself.
Admits to Farood that Bukbuk is actually his fiancée, sharing a personal and vulnerable truth.
Quickly switches from emotional appeal to practical negotiation when persuasion fails, offering valuable gold ring to secure help.
Climbs stealthily to rescue Tamina, reassures her silently, insists on trying despite her protests.
Ignores Tamina's urgent warning to not take the risky knife throw.
Engages in a thoughtful conversation about the tale with Farood, showing interest and respect.
Winks and waves goodbye to the gypsy boy, acknowledging him warmly.
Does not intervene in Farood's struggle with the soldiers, silently moving away with Tamina.
Questions Farood's story thoughtfully, shows curiosity and attentiveness by noticing the checkpoint timing.
Decides to slip through the gate with Tamina quietly amid the commotion, showing situational awareness and timing.
Engages briefly in a discussion about a tale, not directly influencing events but indicates alertness.
Winks and waves goodbye to the gypsy boy watching him.
Takes Tamina by the shoulders to get her to tell him the truth and offers to work together for revenge.
Interrupts Tamina’s reverential silence with a factual correction about there being only one God.
Winks and waves good-bye confidently before slipping through the gate with Tamina.
Shows curiosity and alertness by noticing and questioning what Nizam is doing at the excavation.
Takes initiative to physically engage Tamina, forcing her to face the grim reality and encouraging her to reveal the truth.
Suggests an alliance based on mutual revenge and requests honest communication, demonstrating strategic thinking.
Interrupts Tamina’s reverential silence after her mystical recount of the legend with a blunt factual correction.
Glances down at the dagger with newfound respect.
Refuses to flee and abandon Tamina’s people, showing concern for others beyond himself.
Expresses determination to avenge his father and protect his allies, inspiring hope in Tamina.
Recalls his bond and mutual loyalty with his brother Tus despite differences, highlighting trust and affection.
Shows understanding of the significance of the dagger and hourglass, deducing Nizam's intentions.
Refuses to flee despite danger, motivated by responsibility to his people and avenging his father.
Demonstrates confidence and determination that inspires hope in Tamina.
Follows Tamina through complex alleys demonstrating adaptability and navigation skills.
Acknowledges limitations and past failures (could not ride the wild stallion), but maintains realistic perspective.
Gives his word about his brother's honor, demonstrates trust by slowly handing over the dagger to Tamina despite hesitation and uncertainty.
Shows growing anxiety and discomfort while waiting hidden in the alleyway, indicating difficulty with patience and possibly situational control.
Tells the drunk prisoner to forget previous accusations and hurries to help Tamina escape.
Trusts Tamina and cooperates with her to evade soldiers through the city and marketplace.
Draws his sword to defend against soldiers blocking their escape.
Forgets his previous approach quickly and decisively to chase Tamina, showing adaptability and urgency.
Acknowledges tactical disadvantage when trapped and recognizes all exits are guarded.
Follows Tamina's suggestion to use the storm drain as an escape route, showing trust and openness to collaboration.
Draws his sword confidently when confronted by enemies, prepared for combat.
Is caught off guard by the patrol of soldiers at the storm drain exit, indicating possible gap in planning or reconnaissance.
Nods to the brutish soldier to indicate the debt is squared, showing quick understanding of social/political dynamics.
Shifts uncomfortably and looks away during Tamina's prayer, showing lack of respect or discomfort with ritual.
Casually questions the religious significance (sun god as a lion) and rolls his eyes at the ritual, demonstrating dismissiveness toward cultural customs.
Half-heartedly follows Tamina's respectful approach through the sacred temple, showing reluctance to fully engage with important cultural practices.
Carefully observes the black paving stone and discusses it, showing some attention to detail and willingness to learn.
Tries to respect Tamina's religious beliefs after she warns him about the black stones.
Insists on not following superstition initially, but yields when confronted by Tamina.
Attempts an extremely risky climb and jump to help cross the chasm, motivated to protect or aid Tamina.
Disregards superstition initially but backs down immediately when challenged by Tamina's strong reaction.
Devises a plan to cross the broken chasm by running along the wall instead of attempting a dangerous jump.
Successfully uses wall-running and climbing skills to cross the chasm despite extreme difficulty and danger.
Almost slips while climbing the sheer wall, narrowly avoiding falling onto spikes below.
Shouts reproachfully at Tamina for not warning him about the spikes.
Reassures Tamina by saying 'We'll figure something out' when there's no clear way across.
Acknowledges and respects Tamina’s trust by catching the dagger and making eye contact.
Jokes with the lion statue showing respect and humility rather than worship.
Carefully navigates a corridor with dangerous black stones by hop-scotching on safe stones and using walls to avoid traps.
Realizes the religious significance of the mural and reflects thoughtfully on it.
Makes a risky jump to clear a segment of black stones, adapts by switching to a dive at the last instant and succeeds.
Steps on a black stone, initially unaware of the consequences, showing a brief lapse in cautiousness.
Quickly reacts to the scythe traps by jumping and moving to avoid being cut, demonstrating agility and quick thinking.
Recites a heartfelt prayer in a moment of danger, showing humility and reverence.
Expresses a quick afterthought respecting the 'Lion,' showing tolerance and regard for others' beliefs.
Pushes the dagger into the hourglass to trap the sand, despite not knowing the outcome.
Runs desperately and takes a heroic leap to escape collapsing floor.
Reaches to help Tamina up after they surface from the river.
Dodges arrow near Tamina and defensively deflects blame to the arrow itself.
Grabs Tamina and yanks her back to protect her from incoming arrows.
Releases Tamina immediately after the danger passes.
Acknowledges having used the dagger to save them both but comforts Tamina about it.
Hoists himself onto the embankment despite exhaustion and quickly reacts to the arrow attack by dodging instinctively.
Underestimates the amount of sand used from the dagger, indicating a slight misjudgment of his resources.
Demonstrates tactical awareness by grabbing Tamina and yanking her back just before a volley of arrows passes in front of her, protecting her from harm.
Acknowledges using the dagger again, showing honesty and a pragmatic acceptance of his abilities, while also implying an understanding of the risks involved.
Implements a clever escape by using a judo roll and pole-vault to outmaneuver pursuing soldiers, securing a clear path to the bridge.
Recognizes the dangerous tactical situation of being trapped on a narrow bridge between two armies and swiftly prepares to face the threat.
Considers using the dagger for an advantage but is stopped, then acknowledges this as a missed opportunity.
Pulls Tamina toward him and gives her a passionate kiss in a moment of danger, showing care and connection.
Sits up and gazes at Tamina with a goofy grin, indicating genuine affection and openness.
Voluntarily risks own safety to save Tamina by climbing the rope and leading their escape.
Expresses concern and checks on Tamina by saying 'Hold tight' before their jump.
Adjusts his aim mid-jump and climbs the rope while swinging to secure their escape through the loophole.
Chooses not to use the dagger despite danger and instead relies on physical skill and timing.
Distracted by the kiss, momentarily less focused on immediate danger.
Compliments Tamina sincerely, showing appreciation for her appearance.
Initiates a kiss and shows vulnerability by waiting for her reaction, not controlling the moment.
Responds with defensiveness to Tamina's rejection, indicating insecurity.
Offers to be baptized in the sacred fountain despite the impossibility, showing willingness to meet Tamina's beliefs halfway.
Searches for the right words to speak to his brother to prove his innocence, preparing carefully and nervously.
Locks eyes with Tamina and receives an encouraging nod, indicating a supportive and sincere relationship.
Attempts to persuade Tamina by offering to take a dip in the sacred fountain despite its destruction, showing adaptability but some naivety.
Carefully rehearses what to say before confronting his brother, showing preparation and thoughtfulness.
Presses on the secret door and enters the royal baths stealthily, showing courage and decisive action.
Initially struggles to find the right words to begin his speech, displaying some nervousness.
Throws down his sword and holds up his hands unarmed to show he means no harm.
Earnestly tries to convince Tus and the guards that Nizam is the real villain and pleads for them to listen.
Appeals to the guards with sincere emotion, asking for a chance to speak as they loved Tus and the king.
Does not resort to violence initially and tries peaceful means despite being seized.
Despite being punched and seized, continues to plead and explain the truth.
Draws dagger only after being attacked and restrained, as a last effort to defend and activate the jewel.
Barricades the door to prevent guards from entering.
Throws his sword away to show he doesn't want to fight Tus, but this is misinterpreted and worsens the situation.
Attempts to explain the situation and the significance of the dagger despite Tus’s hostility.
Forgets that the dagger is a weapon and draws it in a threatening way unintentionally.
Acknowledges his mistake when the guards break in and expresses frustration with himself.
Uses the dagger to hold the guards at bay even though outnumbered, showing quick thinking.
Asks for a moment to think, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Recognizes the limited sand left in the dagger and looks to Tus for help, showing strategic awareness.
Threatens to kill himself to prove the seriousness of his claim and the importance of the kingdom’s honor.
Plunges dagger into his own heart in front of others to demonstrate sincerity.
Tries to protest his innocence immediately when accused of killing King Tus.
Allows himself to be bound and silenced by guards without apparent resistance or escape attempt.
Apologizes to Tamina after being beaten and chained, showing concern for her feelings.
Tells Nizam that greatness must be earned, not stolen, expressing sincerity and moral integrity.
Remains defiant and morally strong despite being beaten and captured, asserts that greatness must be earned and cannot be stolen.
Expresses apology to Tamina after being overpowered and disarmed, indicating a moment of vulnerability or failure.
Springs into action to fight guards and attempts to free prisoners despite being outnumbered.
Encourages Farood’s daughters to help tie up guards and get keys to free prisoners.
Pauses on the threshold of freedom, looks back at prisoners he freed and decides to stay and address them despite personal risk.
Unlocks prisoners impulsively and addresses them as their prince, risking causing unrest.
Shows leadership by rallying the prisoners and acknowledging the complex political situation.
Fails to ensure safety before freeing potentially dangerous prisoners, which could have negative consequences.
Despite language barriers, tries to rally the prisoners and lead a fight against soldiers.
Does not argue with Farood’s suggestion to escape, prioritizing survival over reckless heroism.
Pushes Farood down to protect him from arrows, showing protective concern.
Tells Farood to hold the enemy as long as possible while he leaves to save Layla, prioritizing a loved one over comrades.
Smiles at Farood after explaining his urgency, indicating friendly sincerity.
Clobbers Nizam with a human counterweight, uses physical force decisively to interrupt Nizam's plan.
Engages in a duel against Nizam, draws his sword and fights skillfully despite being outmatched in number of weapons.
Knocks one of Nizam's swords from his hand, gaining a tactical advantage in combat.
Blocks Nizam's sword confidently and presses advantage showing youth and strength.
Fails to detect or anticipate Nizam's hidden short sword, getting mortally wounded by a trick.
Shouts ‘Noll!’ in panic as Tamina falls from the abyss, showing concern for her safety.
Lunges to stop Nizam from plunging the dagger into the hourglass, attempting to prevent harm.
Clings to the dagger desperately to prevent disaster despite weakening and injury.
Summons last strength and will to pull out the dagger and attempt to fix the disaster.
Fails to hold onto the dagger and loses it in the sandstorm.
Realizes he is too late to prevent the repeating mistake of battle and expresses dread.
Hangs on to the dagger despite being weak, wounded, and subjected to a violent sandstorm and an opponent's aggression.
Summons last strength and will to pull the dagger out from Nizam, repairing the hourglass crack momentarily.
After being swept into the void and losing the dagger, scans his surroundings and perceives the repeating battle scenario, recognizing the urgency.
Shows a new maturity and resolve, knowing what he must do and attempts to call off a battle to prevent unnecessary bloodshed.
Clashes in a duel with Nizam while trying to ride past him, which causes confusion and allows chaos to escalate in the battle.
Hurls his sword away and offers himself to be killed to stop the attack on Alamut, appealing to Tus's better nature.
References their father's words about listening to reason and heart, showing sincerity and a desire for peace.
Slips away from his brothers during formalities, potentially avoiding engagement.
Hurls his sword away and stands calmly to face Tus, risking himself to stop an unnecessary battle.
Uses reasoned and heartfelt words to persuade Tus to call off the attack despite tense circumstances.
Shows a mature, resolute demeanor unexpectedly, which causes Tus to reconsider his orders.
Slips away from his brothers during formal proceedings without obvious reason noted here.
Smiles warmly at Tamina and winks as if sharing a secret, showing playful friendliness and sincere interest.
Falls into the sacred fountain and is helped out by an irritated priest but remains grinning, showing good-naturedness and tolerance for embarrassment.
Falls into the sacred fountain, requiring help to get out.
Maintains a big grin and winks at Tamina, showing confidence and social savvy despite the mishap.
